item.title: DNS Message & Resource Record Format
item.description: convention and glossaries 0 indicates the most significant bit. RR stands for Resource Record, see below. Message Format DNS is a request-response protocol. The query and the response share the same format which always starts with a header: Q 0 R 1 O 2 p c o 3 d e 4 A 5 A T 6 C Q A N A R D N S R 7 I D C C C C D O O O O R U U U U 8 A N N N N T T T T 9 Z 1 0 1 1 1 2 R 1 3 C O D 1 4 E 1 5 a f c c c c l o o o o r a u u u u e g n n n n s s t t t t p o - o o o o n f f f f s s e e e R R R e n R R R m t s s s u b r s e i i i i t l e n n n o s e w t t t c i h h h h n e e e o q A A A t u n u d h e s t d e s w h i t e o t s i r r i a o i o m n s t n e e y a s c l I e t s D c i e s t o c e o i n t c f o i t n o i i ; n o t n s i .
